death, loss and pain that settled on Algeria two days after a devastating earthquake lifted briefly Friday

ldc_scope.charseq: A pall of death, loss and pain that settled on Algeria two days after a devastating earthquake lifted briefly Friday as a 2-year-old girl emerged alive from the rubble of her crumbled building, spared by the caprices of fate

extent.charseq: Friday as a 2-year-old girl emerged alive

ldc_scope.charseq: A pall of death, loss and pain that settled on Algeria two days after a devastating earthquake lifted briefly Friday as a 2-year-old girl emerged alive from the rubble of her crumbled building, spared by the caprices of fate
``We have only our hands and hammers,'' said Ismail Lizir, 42, also of Corso, one of the towns destroyed by Wednesday night's killer earthquake

extent.charseq: the area east of Algiers, killing more than 1,600 people

ldc_scope.charseq: The 6.8-magnitude quake tore through the area east of Algiers, killing more than 1,600 people and leaving 7,207 injured

extent.charseq: the area east of Algiers, killing more than 1,600 people and leaving 7,207 injured

ldc_scope.charseq: The 6.8-magnitude quake tore through the area east of Algiers, killing more than 1,600 people and leaving 7,207 injured
With heavy machinery in short supply and countless bodies still under rubble, the death toll was expected to rise further
Some villagers said the lack of outside help inflated the death toll
Left to their own devices, townspeople struggled in vain to move huge slabs of cement with their bare hands or shovels, their dying loved ones just meters (yards) away
Germany promised a field hospital, Sweden and Switzerland sent sniffer dogs, Russia dispatched rescue experts

extent.charseq: Turkey pitched in with a search team, tents

ldc_scope.charseq: Turkey pitched in with a search team, tents and medicine

extent.charseq: U.S. President George W. Bush called Algerian President Abdelaziz Bouteflika on Friday

ldc_scope.charseq: U.S. President George W. Bush called Algerian President Abdelaziz Bouteflika on Friday, the official APS news agency reported, saying Bush assured Bouteflika of ``the support and friendship of the United States
The 6.8-magnitude quake was the North African nation's deadliest since a pair of temblors west of the capital killed up to 5,000 in October 1980, according to the U.S. Geological Survey

extent.charseq: elections due next year, support for President Abdelaziz Bouteflika

ldc_scope.charseq: The government has been battling Islamic insurgents for more than a decade and, with elections due next year, support for President Abdelaziz Bouteflika could slide if efforts to help quake survivors flag

extent.charseq: Bouteflika canceled plans to join a summit of world leaders in France next week

ldc_scope.charseq: To oversee rescue efforts, Bouteflika canceled plans to join a summit of world leaders in France next week, APS reported

extent.charseq: Many people were crushed while trying to run down the stairwells

ldc_scope.charseq: Many people were crushed while trying to run down the stairwells to safety
